runs.comm: full and wide of off stump, a swing and a miss, it was just inside the guidelines

oh gone second ball! What a start for Zaheer. A length ball just outside off and Amla nicks off to first slip who takes a good catch down low to his left, claiming it with two hands, a smart grab. Did just enough to shape away from Amla who looked to punch a length ball angled across off stump, it was a healthy edge and well caught
full around middle and leg, worked towards midwicket
step across the stumps, a length ball strikes the pad in line with middle but probably too high, also pitched outside leg
another step across the stumps, playing another good length ball to leg, gets this away from square leg, needed to hit that and did
wander across the off stump again, pushed wider by Zaheer, blocked towards point on the front foot
full and wide, swung at, comes off a toe-end on the bounce to slip
little bit of swing there into the right-hander, pushed to point from middle and leg

full and swinging again, bit of a flick across the line, was late on the shot, got enough bat on it out through square leg, the chase and slide is not in time, his foot is on the rope as Sharma flicks it back
too straight this time, tucked behind square, long leg is a little slow and they get back for two
swings back and catches the back thigh pad, too high for the lbw shout, runs down to third man
waited for and dabbed down to third man from off stump
length around off stump, blocked forward into the covers
step to leg and gets it off a length over the covers, well struck that from just outside off, gave himself room to swing the arms
around the wicket now, outside off, doesn't get up and de Villiers swings and misses trying to slap it away through cover
forward and driven on the bounce to extra cover
forward and pressed back to the bowler, it was angled in towards middle stump
forced away on the pull past mid on, didn't get all of it having charged down and got cramped
swing and a miss outside off, again the ball didn't quite get up, Kallis was a touch head in the air
shape into leg stump, tucked to midwicket
full and wide, left alone outside off
little too straight, worked down to long leg
short and wide, slapped to the cover fence, finds the gap well, poor ball
forward and guided down to third man, wide enough for a couple
forward again, this time pressed only to cover
driven over the top of cover, didn't get all of it, chipped over the fielders from off stump, a check drive over cover
angled in, stayed in the crease and tried to square drive, it kept a little low and beat the stroke, beat off stump not by much
fuller and this is timed superbly over mid off, struck really nicely, a full blade of the bat and it carries all the way for six, clean strike from off stump
middle and leg, full ball, whipped down to long leg on the bounce
outside off, tucked down to third man, just opening the face
length well outside off, a slug towards cover comes off a huge inside edge past the stumps down to long leg
lovely shot this, timing is excellent again, driven over extra cover to a slower ball that was too full just outside off stump
similar line but a better length, guided towards point
wide off stump, slapped past extra cover, again the timing is excellent from du Plessis and he'll get four more
was wide again, reached for but comes off another inside edge fine of long leg, couple more

and it worked immediately as de Villiers chops on. Yuvraj strikes again! It was very slow around middle and off, de Villiers waited in the crease for it but ended up blocking it onto the base of off stump, poor way to go but India take another
sliding across the left-hander, goes to cut and misses
pushed into the covers from just outside off
floated up onto leg stump, flicked away wide of midwicket, placed well
similar line, clipped out to the midwicket fence again but straight to the fielder this time
off stump and full, clipped down to long offf
leg stump line, whipped into the on side, deep midwicket fields
outside off, driven through the covers on the front foot
full and paddle swept behind square on the leg side, two fine of deep backward square
paddle swept again, this time from further outside off, two more
down the wicket and picked up over cow corner, timed well that, whipped away over the fielder out there, played it well
flatter ball, kept out on the crease into the covers
outside off and full, cracked wide of long off for a couple, decent timing on show again
played towards the same region but squarer and just a single point
down to reverse sweep, only as far as backward point
back to cut and only gets it off the bottom edge back to the bowler
length outside off, pushed down to long on
taken off the stumps on the back foot into midwicket
flat outside off, tucked behind square on the off side for a single
oh that is perfect, pitched on middle, turned sharply away past the outside edge, comprehensively beaten
little shorter, stayed back and tucked into midwicket
moved with the spin past the 45 on the leg side, not the best effort from Zaheer, two as backward square comes round
full and punched down the ground, terrible effort from Ashwin this time, allows it to go past his right hand
this scurries onto the off stump and it tucked towards backward point
full on the stumps, pushed down the ground on the front foot
leg stump, whipped out to deep square leg
flat onto off stump, slapped to extra cover
stride down the wicket, a huge swing and miss, in fact a thin inside edge and a terrible effort again by Zaheer and this runs away for four
flatter and straight, hurries the batsman who forces it back to the bowler
off stump, came down again, only gets it to extra cover
full onto the off stump, worked down to mid off
length ball around off stump, mistimed to extra cover
slower ball just outside off, slapped down to long off
slower shorter ball, pulled down to long leg
taken from outside off and slogged just past midwicket for four
finds the same boundary, this time more in the air, flicked over the top, again from outside off, a touch fuller and picked up well into the gap at midwicket
leg stump and whipped through midwicket for just a single
flatter ball onto leg stump, strikes the pad, cry for lbw but going down leg
inside-out drive over extra cover, lovely timing and gets the placement just right again

goes again but this is too straight and caught at long off the timing was similar to the previous ball but this was not placed well and straight to the fielder. Went down the wicket again to find the rope but didn't get it into the gap, another strike for Yuvraj
taken from off stump out to deep square leg with a flick
floated up, ends being a full toss and cracked down to long off, wide enough of the fielder for two
floated up towards middle stump, blocked into the covers, easy single
sharp turn from just outside off, worked very late behind square on the leg side
flatter ball Duminy goes back and blocks up towards the bowler
swept from off stump out to the leg side fence, midwicket comes around but can't prevent two
worked into the leg side again, just a single this time
waited for in the crease and dabbed through midwicket
just outside off, dabbed through cover for another very easy single
back of a length, bit of an awkward pull down to long leg
slower ball way outside off, reached for so far and off the toe to extra cover
pulled again into the deep, easy run
Duminy steps to leg, the bowler cramps him up and can only force this back to the bowler trying to pull

length ball and swept to deep square leg Picked out the fielder on the on side boundary, got down and tried to sweep it around the corner, got it flat and hard but not the elevation and the fielder came in and took a straightforward catch
skids on to middle and off, worked out through square leg
flat, skiddy ball again, missed outside off
similar line outside off, flicked down to long on with the wrists

switch hit and finds the fielder at point for an easy catch...but oh my good heavens, Ashwin has overstepped, that is an absolute utter and complete shocker from the bowler, dreadful, hideous, unforgivable. They had a check and Peterson survives
and now bowls him off stump going for another switch hit! Hilarious, except if you're an Indian fan of course, in which case it's more bad luck
now plays properly and gets two wide of long off with a delightful chip after stepping down
last ball played to point on the front foot
short and pulled past midwicket, good timing
length ball, jags back a little and catches the batsman on the pad, going down so not out, leg bye to point
slower short ball, blooped into the leg side on the pull, they come back for the second and make it, umpire just checks upstairs
length ball again, goes across his stumps to flick to leg, struck on the pad to point
slower short ball, pulled off a glove wide of the keeper and that's it for India
mid off is up so this is four, lifted up on over the in-field, good timing this, length ball on off stump timed nicely
length ball around off stump, goes down and paddles down to third man, loves playing the wrong way goes old Peterson
slower ball, plays with hard hands down the ground, chipped up and it carries to long on running in off the rope to claim a comfortable catch
oh lovely, two in two as Peterson is yorked. Perfect inswinging yorker onto the base of off stump as Peterson backed away and tried to play into the off side, done by a beauty
short and leg side, hooked at and missed, obviously close enough to leg stump to be legal
leg stump flicked into midwicket
gets the yorker spot on again but the bat comes down at the very last moment and keeps it out to long leg
floated up and tucked from off stump towards point
leg stump, flicked in the air down the ground, nearly carries to long on
meets this on the full outside off, slapped down to long off
but that will help, a gorgeous strike down the ground for a straight six, beauty of shot, a step down and timed to perfection over the rope

goes again but this time find long off who goes to his left to take a two-handed catch at head height, wasn't quite to the pitch and reached out for it, slapping it almost wide enough of long off but not far enough
full on the off stump, dug out past extra cover
hoho! First ball slugged over midwicket, what a shot, pitched outside leg, a little slower than normal, batsman clears the front leg and smashes it over the rope, big hit

another slower ball, this time fuller outside off and he drags it on so India back on top. Backed away and tried to go off side, got a thin edge onto the middle stump, was reaching out for it and it came off a thin bottom edge
another slower ball, really well bowled, Morkel totally deceived and was there way too soon as it went over middle stump
oh amazing! Into the stands again! Picks up a back of a length ball going back in the crease and it's a huge shot, 78 metres over square leg, what a shot that is

got him!! Full onto the off stump and Morkel swings and misses, is cleaned up and India win it by a run! What an ending. After a terrible long hop, Balaji has responded really well there with a fast, straight yorker that was too good for Morkel
